com.box.androidlib
Class Box

java.lang.Object
  com.box.androidlib.Box

public class Box
extends java.lang.Object

Use this class to execute requests asynchronously against the Box REST API. Full details about the Box API can be found at http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923956/ApiOverview . You must have an OpenBox application with a valid API key to use the Box API. All methods in this class put the Box API request into a background thread, and therefore do not block and are safe to execute in the UI thread of your application. Results of the request are obtained through a ResponseListener that is passed into the methods.

ResponseListener callbacks are invoked in the UI Thread. So, for example, if you execute Box.getTicket(getTicketListener), then getTicketListener.onComplete() will be executed on the UI thread.

If you would like to execute requests synchronously (e.g. you already have a worker thread or AsyncTask you want to put the request into), then use BoxSynchronous.

Author:
developers@box.net

Method Detail

getInstance

public static Box getInstance(java.lang.String apiKey)
Returns an instance of Box with the given API key. You must have an API key to execute requests against the Box API. If you do not already have an API key, create an OpenBox application at https://www.box.net/developers/

This method must be executed in the UI thread.

Parameters:
apiKey - The API key of your OpenBox application
Returns:
An instance of Box

setBoxFolderClass

public static void setBoxFolderClass(java.lang.Class<? extends BoxFolder> boxFolderClass)
Set the BoxFolder class that will be created by response parsers. This can be used if you want to have your own custom class that extends BoxFolder.

Parameters:
boxFolderClass - The BoxFolder class.

getBoxFolderClass

public static java.lang.Class<? extends BoxFolder> getBoxFolderClass()
Get the BoxFolder class to be instantiated by response parsers.

getTicket

public final void getTicket(GetTicketListener listener)
This method is used in the authentication process. The ticket obtained from this method is used to generate an authentication page for the user to login. Executes API action get_ticket: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923936/ApiFunction_get_ticket

Parameters:
listener - The callback that will run

getAuthToken

public final void getAuthToken(java.lang.String ticket,
                               GetAuthTokenListener listener)
This method is used in the authorization process. You should call this method after the user has authorized oneself on the Box partner authentication page. Executes API action get_auth_token: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923930/ApiFunction_get_auth_token

Parameters:
ticket - The ticket that you obtained through getTicket(GetTicketListener)
listener - The callback that will run

getAccountTree

public final void getAccountTree(java.lang.String authToken,
                                 long folderId,
                                 java.lang.String[] params,
                                 GetAccountTreeListener listener)
This method is used to get a tree representing all of the user's files and folders. Executes API action get_account_tree: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923929/ApiFunction_get_account_tree

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
folderId - The ID of the root folder from which the tree begins. If this value is 0, the user's full account tree is returned.
params - An array of strings. Possible values are PARAM_ONELEVEL, PARAM_NOFILES, PARAM_NOZIP, PARAM_SIMPLE. Currently, PARAM_NOZIP is always included automatically.
listener - The callback that will run

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
fileId - The id of the file for with you want to obtain more information.
listener - The callback that will run

                               long parentFolderId,
                               java.lang.String folderName,
                               boolean share,
                               CreateFolderListener listener)
Create a folder in a user's account.

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
parentFolderId - The folder_id of the folder in which the new folder will be created
folderName - The name of the folder to be created
share - Set to true to be allow the folder to be shared
listener - The callback that will run

copy

public final void copy(java.lang.String authToken,
                       java.lang.String type,
                       long targetId,
                       long destinationId,
                       CopyListener listener)
Copies a file into another folder. Executes API action copy: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923924/APIFunction_copy

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
type - The type of item to be copied. Currently, this should only be set to TYPE_FILE
targetId - The id of the item to be copied (i.e. file id)
destinationId - The id of the folder to which the item will be copied
listener - The callback that will run

search

public final void search(java.lang.String authToken,
                         java.lang.String query,
                         java.lang.String sort,
                         int page,
                         int perPage,
                         java.lang.String direction,
                         java.lang.String[] params,
                         SearchListener listener)
This method gets a list of items that would normally be obtained through search. Executes API action search: http://developers.box.net/w/page/22888693/ApiFunction_search

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
query - The text to search for
sort - The method in which the results may be sorted. Set to SORT_RELEVANCE, SORT_NAME, SORT_DATE or SORT_SIZE
page - The page number, which begins on page 1. This coincides with the per_page parameter
perPage - The number of search results to display per page
direction - Set to either DIRECTION_ASC or DIRECTION_DESC
params - Array of string params that can include SEARCH_PARAM_SHOW_DESCRIPTION and/or SEARCH_PARAM_SHOW_PATH
listener - The callback that will run

addToTag

public final void addToTag(java.lang.String authToken,
                           java.lang.String type,
                           long targetId,
                           java.lang.String[] tagNames,
                           AddToTagListener listener)
This method applies tags to a designated file or folder. Executes API action add_to_tag: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923921/ApiFunction_add_to_tag

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
type - The type of item to which the tags will be applied. Set to TYPE_FILE or TYPE_FOLDER
targetId - The file_id or folder_id of the item to which the tags will be applied
tagNames - Array of tag names
listener - The callback that will run

                             ExportTagsListener listener)
Retrieve a list of tags in the user's account. Executes API action export_tags: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923927/ApiFunction_export_tags

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
listener - The callback that will run

getUpdates

public final void getUpdates(java.lang.String authToken,
                             long beginTimeStamp,
                             long endTimeStamp,
                             java.lang.String[] params,
                             GetUpdatesListener listener)
Returns the contents of a user's Updates tab on box.net. Executes API action get_updates: http://developers.box.net/w/page/22926051/ApiFunction_get_updates

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
beginTimeStamp - a unix_timestamp of the earliest point in time to obtain an update (the time of the oldest update you want to display)
endTimeStamp - a unix_timestamp of the latest point in time to obtain an update
params - array of parameters. Currently, the only supported parameter is PARAM_NOZIP
listener - The callback that will run

folderId - The folder_id for which the upload email will be enabled or disabled
enable - Set to true to enable, false to disable
listener - The callback that will run

publicShare

public final void publicShare(java.lang.String authToken,
                              java.lang.String type,
                              long targetId,
                              java.lang.String password,
                              java.lang.String shareMsg,
                              java.lang.String[] emails,
                              PublicShareListener listener)
This method makes a file or folder shareable, and may initiate sharing through Box email notifications. Executes API action public_share: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923943/ApiFunction_public_share

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
type - The type of item to be shared. Set to TYPE_FILE or TYPE_FOLDER
targetId - The file_id or folder_id of the item
password - The password to protect the folder or file.
shareMsg - A message to be included in a notification email.
emails - An array of emails to notify users about the newly shared file or folder.
listener - The callback that will run

privateShare

public final void privateShare(java.lang.String authToken,
                               java.lang.String type,
                               long targetId,
                               java.lang.String message,
                               java.lang.String[] emails,
                               boolean notify,
                               PrivateShareListener listener)
Privately shares a file or folder with other users. Executes API action private_unshare: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923942/ApiFunction_private_share

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
type - The type of item to be shared. Set to TYPE_FILE or TYPE_FOLDER
targetId - The file_id or folder_id of the item
message - A message to be included in a notification email
emails - An array of emails to notify users about the newly shared file or folder.
notify - Set to true to send a notification email to users. If set to false, notifications will not be sent
listener - The callback that will run

inviteCollaborators

public void inviteCollaborators(java.lang.String authToken,
                                java.lang.String type,
                                long targetId,
                                long[] userIds,
                                java.lang.String[] emails,
                                java.lang.String itemRoleName,
                                boolean resendInvite,
                                boolean noEmail,
                                java.lang.String[] params,
                                InviteCollaboratorsListener listener)
Invites one or more users/emails to collaborate on a folder. Executes API action invite_collaborators: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923938/ApiFunction_invite_collaborators

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through BoxSynchronous.getAuthToken(String)
type - The type of item to be shared. Set to TYPE_FOLDER
targetId - The file_id or folder_id of the item
userIds - An array of user ids that the folder will be collaborated with. Can be null.
emails - An array of email addresses that the folder will be collaborated with. Can be null.
itemRoleName - Set to either ITEM_ROLE_VIEWER or ITEM_ROLE_EDITOR.
resendInvite - Whether the invitation is being re-sent.
noEmail - If true, no e-mail notification will be sent about the invitation.
params - An array of parameters. TODO missing documentation for this. Set as null for now.
listener - The callback that will run

addToMyBox

public final void addToMyBox(java.lang.String authToken,
                             java.lang.Long fileId,
                             java.lang.String publicName,
                             long folderId,
                             java.lang.String[] tags,
                             AddToMyBoxListener listener)
This method copies a file that publicly shared by another individual and into a user's a designated folder in the user's Box. Executes API action add_to_mybox: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923920/ApiFunction_add_to_mybox

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through BoxSynchronous.getAuthToken(String)
fileId - The id of the file you wish to copy.
publicName - The unique public name of the shared file that you wish to copy.
folderId - The folder_id of the folder to which you will copy the item.
tags - A List of tags to apply to the file when copied into the user's own folder. Can be set to null if there are no tags.
listener - The callback that will run

download

public final Cancelable download(java.lang.String authToken,
                                 long fileId,
                                 java.io.File destinationFile,
                                 java.lang.Long versionId,
                                 FileDownloadListener listener)
Download a file. Uses the download API as described here: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923951/ApiFunction_Upload-and-Download This method returns a Cancelable which you can use to cancel a download in progress.

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
fileId - The file_id of the file to be downloaded
destinationFile - A java.io.File resource to which the downloaded file will be written. Ensure that this points to a valid file-path that can be written to.
versionId - The version_id of the version of the file to download. Set to null to download the latest version of the file.
listener - A file download listener. You will likely be interested in callbacks FileDownloadListener.onProgress(long) and FileDownloadListener.onComplete(String)
Returns:
A Cancelable that allows you to try to cancel a download in progress.

upload

public final Cancelable upload(java.lang.String authToken,
                               java.lang.String action,
                               java.io.File file,
                               java.lang.String filename,
                               long destinationId,
                               FileUploadListener listener)
Upload a file from the device to a folder at Box. Uses the upload API as described here: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923951/ApiFunction_Upload-and-Download This method returns a Cancelable which you can use to cancel an upload in progress.

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
action - Set to UPLOAD_ACTION_UPLOAD or UPLOAD_ACTION_OVERWRITE or UPLOAD_ACTION_NEW_COPY
file - A File resource pointing to the file you wish to upload. Make sure File.isFile() and File.canRead() are true for this resource.
filename - The desired filename on Box after upload (just the file name, do not include the path)
destinationId - If action is UPLOAD_ACTION_UPLOAD, then this is the folder id where the file will uploaded to. If action is UPLOAD_ACTION_OVERWRITE or UPLOAD_ACTION_NEW_COPY, then this is the file_id that is being overwrriten, or copied.
listener - A file upload listener. You will likely be interested in callbacks FileUploadListener.onProgress(long) and FileUploadListener.onComplete(com.box.androidlib.DAO.BoxFile, String)
Returns:
A Cancelable that allows you to try to cancel an upload in progress.

upload

public final Cancelable upload(java.lang.String authToken,
                               java.lang.String action,
                               java.io.InputStream sourceInputStream,
                               java.lang.String filename,
                               long destinationId,
                               FileUploadListener listener)
Upload a file from the device to a folder at Box. Uses the upload API as described here: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923951/ApiFunction_Upload-and-Download This method returns a Cancelable which you can use to cancel an upload in progress.

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
action - Set to UPLOAD_ACTION_UPLOAD or UPLOAD_ACTION_OVERWRITE or UPLOAD_ACTION_NEW_COPY
sourceInputStream - An input stream targeting the data you wish to upload.
filename - The desired filename on Box after upload (just the file name, do not include the path)
destinationId - If action is UPLOAD_ACTION_UPLOAD, then this is the folder id where the file will uploaded to. If action is UPLOAD_ACTION_OVERWRITE or UPLOAD_ACTION_NEW_COPY, then this is the file_id that is being overwrriten, or copied.
listener - A file upload listener. You will likely be interested in callbacks FileUploadListener.onProgress(long) and FileUploadListener.onComplete(com.box.androidlib.DAO.BoxFile, String)
Returns:
A Cancelable that allows you to try to cancel an upload in progress.

upload

@Deprecated
public final void upload(java.lang.String action,
                                    java.lang.String absoluteFilePath,
                                    java.lang.String authToken,
                                    long destinationId,
                                    FileUploadListener listener)
Deprecated. replaced by #upload(String, String, File, String, long). Do not use this.

Upload a file to Box. This method is depracated.

Parameters:
action - Set to UPLOAD_ACTION_UPLOAD or UPLOAD_ACTION_OVERWRITE or UPLOAD_ACTION_NEW_COPY
absoluteFilePath - Absolute filepath of the file to be uploaded.
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String, GetAuthTokenListener)
destinationId - If action is UPLOAD_ACTION_UPLOAD, then this is the folder id where the file will uploaded to. If action is UPLOAD_ACTION_OVERWRITE or UPLOAD_ACTION_NEW_COPY, then this is the file_id that is being overwrriten, or copied.
listener - A file upload listener. You will likely be interested in callbacks FileUploadListener.onProgress(long) and com.box.androidlib.ResponseListeners.FileUploadListener#onComplete(com.android.box.DAO.BoxFile, String)
